trans-unit.source: Represents a workflow queue.
Workflow queues are used to pass messages between a host or host services and activities in a workflow.

Any activity can create a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue> by calling <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueuingService.CreateWorkflowQueue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, and a host, a service, or another activity can call <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Enqueue%2A> to add an item to that <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue>.
You can subscribe to the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable> event to be notified when an item arrives on the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue>.

You can use <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Peek%2A> to examine an item at the beginning of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue> and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Dequeue%2A> to remove an item from the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue>.

Each <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue> is associated with a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueuingService> that you can use to perform other management operations on the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue>, such as deleting the queue.
<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueuingService%2A> exposes the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueuingService> associated with this <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue>.
Gets the number of items contained in the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
The number of items in the workflow queue.
Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.

You can check <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Count%2A> to determine whether the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue> is empty before you call <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Dequeue%2A>, or you can catch the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
The object that is removed from the beginning of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> is empty.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> is enabled.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> is enabled; otherwise `false`.
Adds an object to the end of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
The object to add to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> is not enabled.
Returns the object at the beginning of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> without removing it.

This method is similar to the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Dequeue%2A> method, but <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Peek%2A> does not modify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue>.

You can check <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Count%2A> to determine whether the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue> is empty before you call <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.Dequeue%2A>, or you can catch the <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
The object at the beginning of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref> is empty.
Occurs when an item is delivered on this <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
This event is only used for processing that must occur synchronously with event delivery to the workflow instance.
The event handler may execute on a non-workflow thread so access to any shared workflow object, for example, any <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject>, must be protected.
Occurs when an item is available on this <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable> event is raised in an asynchronous manner.

The sender for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable> event will be the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext> of the subscribing <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.
Gets the name of the workflow queue.
The name of the workflow queue is set by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueuingService.CreateWorkflowQueue%2A> method.
The name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
Gets the queuing service associated with this <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueuingService"></xref> that represents the queuing service associated with this <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue"></xref>.
Registers a subscriber to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemArrived"></xref> event.
A subscriber for <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs"></xref> that implements the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> interface.
Registers a subscriber to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable"></xref> event.
A subscriber for <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs"></xref> that implements the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> interface.
eventListener is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Registers a subscriber to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable"></xref> event.

If the qualified name of the subscribing activity is supplied by `subscriberQualifiedName`, it is returned in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueueInfo.SubscribedActivityNames%2A?displayProperty=fullName> of <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueueInfo> associated with this queue when <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.GetWorkflowQueueData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is called.
A subscriber for <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs"></xref> that implements the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> interface.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.QualifiedName"></xref> of the activity that is subscribing to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable"></xref> event or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
eventListener is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Unregisters a subscriber to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemArrived"></xref> event.
This method is reserved for internal use only.
A subscriber for <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs"></xref> that implements the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> interface.
eventListener is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Unregisters a subscriber to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowQueue.QueueItemAvailable"></xref> event.
A subscriber for <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs"></xref> that implements the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> interface.
eventListener is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
